metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4931 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
epan/proto.c in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.9 and 1.10.x before 1.10.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (loop) via a crafted packet that is not properly handled by the GSM RR dissector.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.6-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
